conclusion: Analyze forces on hemispheres A and B to find dynamic friction coefficient between A and the wall.
Hemisphere A has mass m, line between centers makes 30° angle with horizontal.
Forces on A: gravitational force mg downward, normal force FN right, frictional force Ff upward, contact force F at 30° to horizontal.
Resolve contact force F into components: Fx = (√3/2)F, Fy = (1/2)F.
Write force balance equations for A: FN = Fx, Ff + Fy = mg.
Hemisphere B has mass 2m, smooth, forces: gravitational force 2mg downward, normal force FN1 left, contact force F at 30° to horizontal.
Resolve contact force F into components for B: Fx = (√3/2)F, Fy = (1/2)F.
Write force balance equations for B: FN1 = Fx, Fy = 2mg, solve for F: F = 4mg.
Solve for frictional force Ff using vertical force balance for A: Ff = -mg.
